items: fall hazards (working at height, implied by cranes and upper floor view)
hazards.details: The work is being conducted at an elevated level, indicated by the presence of cranes and the view of the surrounding landscape. There are overhead structures (scaffolding/beams) and heavy materials (concrete blocks) being handled. While one worker is wearing PPE (hard hat, safety glasses, gloves), the general environment of an active construction site at height presents inherent risks.

reasoning: The frames show workers engaged in constructing walls with concrete blocks and mortar, which is a form of framing. The presence of materials, other workers, and heavy machinery indicates active work. The worker wearing the camera is moving or observing, and another worker is actively working on the wall.
